explanation:
Agent A is correct. MISRA C:2023 Rule 2.2 prohibits dead code: "Any operation that is executed but whose removal would not affect program behaviour constitutes dead code." In the provided project mhd_assert is defined as

#define mhd_assert(ignore) ((void)0)

so every mhd_assert(...) call in transmit_error_response_len expands to a no-op expression-statement ((void)0); those statements are executed (they do nothing) and removing them would not change the runtime behaviour of this build. Hence they meet the definition of dead code and constitute a Rule 2.2 violation for this project configuration.

Note on context: if this project were analysed under a different build configuration in which mhd_assert expands to active checks, then the statements would not be dead in that configuration. MISRA conformance is determined with respect to the actual project configuration, so given the provided definition the report is correct. Recommended fixes are to remove the no-op assertions, guard them with a compile-time conditional so they are not present in the final build, or document and approve a MISRA deviation if the assertions must remain as written.
